traits.listing_among_twelve: Named in Mark’s roster of the Twelve as James the son of Alphaeus.
traits.lack_of_narrative_detail: Receives no individual stories, speeches, or distinctive characterization beyond his inclusion in the list.

traits.mission_list: Appears in the list of the Twelve whom Jesus commissions and sends out with authority over unclean spirits and disease.
traits.collective_portrayal: Like several of the lesser-known apostles, functions primarily as part of the collective rather than as an individually profiled figure.

traits.selection_and_appointment: Included in Luke’s list of those whom Jesus names apostles after a night of prayer.
traits.presence_in_early_community: Named among those gathered in the upper room in Jerusalem after the ascension, participating in prayer as they await the Spirit.
traits.ongoing_anonymity: Apart from these lists, remains unelaborated, illustrating how the foundational group includes both prominent and largely anonymous witnesses.
traits.later_traditions: Later Christian tradition associates him with other figures called James (such as James the Less), but the canonical texts do not explicitly make these identifications.
